question.title: MainActivity Error when moved to intermediate activity
question.body:
1. In my original code, I have an activity named MainActivity. In this activity, I need to use Google Maps.

When I run the program, everything works fine and correctly displays the activity's contents.

MainActivity Good

  1. My Android Manifest is as follows:
<activity
            android:name="morfonio.dbacks.MapJumpers.DisplayMessageActivity"
            android:exported="false"
            android:configChanges="orientation|screenSize"
            android:parentActivityName="morfonio.dbacks.MapJumpers.MainActivity"/></activity>

<activity
            android:name="morfonio.dbacks.MapJumpers.MainActivity"
            android:configChanges="orientation|screenSize"
            android:exported="true"       >
            
            <intent-filter>
                <action android:name="android.intent.action.MAIN" />

                <category android:name="android.intent.category.LAUNCHER" />
            </intent-filter>
</activity>
  1. For an update from the previous version, I need to add new activities where the user logs in and is subsequently sent to the MainActivity containing the Google Map. This means that the MainActivity now moves to an intermediate activity instead of the initial one, and that another new activity (SplashActivity) is the Main Activity in this case.

Using intents, when I move from SplashActivity, it directs me to NewActivity, from there to HomeActivity, and there's a button I added to now direct me to MainActivity. But this is where the error appears because this time the MainActivity appears completely empty. The rest of the activities work fine.

SplashActivity Good

HomeActivity Good

MainActivity Error

  1. My Android Manifest is as follows:
<activity
            android:name="morfonio.dbacks.MapJumpers.DisplayMessageActivity"
            android:exported="false"
            android:configChanges="orientation|screenSize"
            android:parentActivityName="morfonio.dbacks.MapJumpers.MainActivity"/>
        
</activity>

<activity
            android:name="morfonio.dbacks.MapJumpers.MainActivity"
            android:configChanges="orientation|screenSize"
            android:exported="true"      >
            
           
</activity>

<activity android:exported="true" android:name="morfonio.dbacks.MapJumpers.NewActivity" ></activity>
<activity android:exported="true" android:name="morfonio.dbacks.MapJumpers.HomeActivity" ></activity>
<activity android:exported="true" android:name="morfonio.dbacks.MapJumpers.MapaActivity"></activity>
<activity android:exported="true" android:name="morfonio.dbacks.MapJumpers.PerfilUsuarioActivity"></activity>
<activity android:exported="true" android:name="morfonio.dbacks.MapJumpers.PerfilEmpresaActivity"></activity>
<activity android:exported="true" android:name="morfonio.dbacks.MapJumpers.PerfilEmpresa2Activity"></activity>
<activity android:exported="true" android:name="morfonio.dbacks.MapJumpers.PerfilConfiguracionActivity"></activity>
<activity android:exported="true" android:name="morfonio.dbacks.MapJumpers.SplashActivity">
     <intent-filter>
         <action android:name="android.intent.action.MAIN" />

         <category android:name="android.intent.category.LAUNCHER" />
     </intent-filter>
</activity>

Can you help me fix this?

question_comments.body: Edit your question. Post the code you use to launch the MainActivity. Have you checked logcat for any errors when you launch MainActivity? Add some debug loging to MainActivity to see what it is doing.
Please provide enough code so others can better understand or reproduce the problem.

Having several activities has been an anti-pattern for several years now -- the recommendation is to use fewer activities, with fragments or composables for individual screens. Beyond that, we have no idea what your MainActivity code is, and so we have no good means of commenting on why that code is not doing what you expect.
